- [Instructor] You may want
to add a user interface theme

to your application, so
that it follows your brand
guidelines or personal preferences.
We'll discuss this and also how to update
your app's designs within this video.

First, install the AWS
Amplify Theme Editor plugin.

Once it's installed, you see
this little check over here.

Then go to your Figma
file for the project.
Go to the Figma dropdown, then plugins,
then AWS Amplify Theme Editor.
You'll be able to configure all the styles
for your application.
So if I change my main color to the blue
and my secondary color to the pink,
then click update theme,
you'll see that my components update.

You can also do this for
spacing, font sizes, borders
and individual components,
like just the buttons for example.
There are also themes that you can use.
If you wanna use something preset.
I'll go back to pink and teal.

Now back in Amplify Studio,
I'll click sync with Figma.

you'll first see a page with
information about this theme.
I'll accept all changes.

This would be the same
exact workflow you'd follow

if you updated any of
your components in Figma.
You could change something within there,
then click sync with Figma within studio

and it will add your UI
changes to the application.
Now that our changes are in studio,

I'm going to go to my
command line interface.

Now in my command line
interface over on Amplify Pull

Amplify Pull will pull the
changes that I made in studio
into my local application.

Now that Amplify Pull
has finished running,

my user interface
components have regenerated.
There's a file here called studio theme

which has all the information
about my user interface theme.

You can also create a custom
theme file if you want.
I'll import this.

Then I'll pass it to the
Amplify provider component.
Now my color theme will match
the one that I set up in Figma.

You're now able to update
themes and components in Figma
and sync them to your local application.
